com.leantegra.wibeat.sdk.monitoring

Class ScanServiceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.leantegra.wibeat.sdk.monitoring.ScanServiceManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServiceConnection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackgroundScanManager

    public class ScanServiceManager
extends Object
implements ServiceConnection
    Allows to scan WiBeat beacons in Activity and Service.

    This class is really just a wrapper for a BeaconScanService and used to interact with the scan service.

    Note: All interactions with service is available after ScanServiceConsumer.onBind() callback.

    Usage: 
     //Create scan service manager
 mScanServiceManager = new ScanServiceManager(context, this);
 //Set foreground scan period
 mScanServiceManager.setForegroundScanPeriod(5000, 0);
 //Set scan mode
 mScanServiceManager.setScanMode(SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY);
 //Set scan listener or use setRangingListener()
 mScanServiceManager.setScanListener(new ScanListener() {
     @Override
     public void onScanResult(BaseFrame baseFrame) {
         //Scan results will be here
     }
 });
 //Connect to scan service
 mScanServiceManager.bind();
    Since:
    1.4.0
    See Also:
    BackgroundScanManager

      • setForegroundScanPeriod

        public void setForegroundScanPeriod(int activePeriod,
                                    int passivePeriod)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds of scan cycle in the foreground mode.

        Warning: From Android N applications can starting and stopping scans not more 5 times in 30 seconds. Be sure that the general number of active and passive period during 30 second wasn't more than 5 for Android N.
        Parameters:
        activePeriod - The duration scan
        passivePeriod - The duration between scan
        See Also:
        setBackgroundMode(boolean)

      • setBackgroundScanPeriod

        public void setBackgroundScanPeriod(int activePeriod,
                                    int passivePeriod)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds of scan cycle in the background mode.

        Warning: From Android N applications can starting and stopping scans not more 5 times in 30 seconds. Be sure that the general number of active and passive period during 30 second wasn't more than 5 for Android N.
        Parameters:
        activePeriod - The duration scan
        passivePeriod - The duration between scan
        See Also:
        setBackgroundMode(boolean)

      • setScanMode

        public void setScanMode(int scanMode)
        Set scan mode for Bluetooth LE scan. For devices running on Android OS with version lower than Lollipop this parameter does not affect scan performance.
        Parameters:
        scanMode - The scan mode can be one of ScanConfig.SCAN_MODE_LOW_POWER, ScanConfig.SCAN_MODE_BALANCED or ScanConfig.SCAN_MODE_LOW_LATENCY.

      • setBackgroundMode

        public void setBackgroundMode(boolean backgroundMode)
        Changes the scan service mode between foreground and background.
        Parameters:
        backgroundMode - Scan service mode

      • startScan

        public void startScan()
        Start scanning BLE devices.

        Note: Scan will be started automatically after binding with scan service.

        Warning: Scan will be started for all instances of ScanServiceManager.

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stop scanning BLE devices.

        Warning: Scan will be stopped for all instances of ScanServiceManager, and it will be started manually.

      • isScanning

        public boolean isScanning()
        Get the state of scan
        Returns:
        true if scan is on, otherwise false
        Since:
        1.5.0

      • addMonitoringRegion

        public void addMonitoringRegion(@NonNull
                                Region region)
        Starts monitoring for a given region. Results will be delivered to the listener registered using setMonitoringListener(com.leantegra.wibeat.sdk.monitoring.listeners.MonitoringListener).

        If the region is already monitored, then it is ignored. You can monitor multiple regions at the same time. Listener will be called for each region separately.

        Parameters:
        region - Region to monitor

      • removeMonitoringRegion

        public void removeMonitoringRegion(@NonNull
                                   Region region)
        Stops monitoring for a given region.
        Parameters:
        region - Region that was monitored

      • addMonitoringRegion

        public void addMonitoringRegion(@NonNull
                                Collection<Region> regions)
        Starts monitoring for a given regions. Results will be delivered to the listener registered using setMonitoringListener(com.leantegra.wibeat.sdk.monitoring.listeners.MonitoringListener).

        If the region is already monitored, then it is ignored. You can monitor multiple regions at the same time. Listener will be called for each region separately.

        Parameters:
        regions - Regions to monitor

      • removeMonitoringRegion

        Stops monitoring for a given regions.
        Parameters:
        regions - Regions that was monitored
